title: Thunderbird V115.5.0 (on Debian Linux) - Can't Find the "Font Toolbar" in email "Write" window ... Where is it?
content:
Thunderbird V115.5.0 (on Debian Linux) - Can't Find the "Font Toolbar" in email "Write" window ... Where is it?

I've been using Thunderbird as my email client for decades. After a recent upgrade to software on my Debian Linux PC, I cannot find nor enable the "Font Toolbar" that was once available within the Write Window. I'd like to continue to employ Thunderbird as my email client, but this feature/capability is a necessity.

The "Font Toolbar" enables one to modify the size, color, and spacing(s) of characters, letters, words, and/or paragraphs, and one may also adjust the super- or sub-script, underlining, over-lining, etc., of the same.

I've just spent several hours attempting to enable this, searching and trying lots of bad ideas on the local Thunderbird GUI's settings. Still.... NO TOOLBAR! This is very disturbing for me. Given the plethora of search results returned during searches, this has been recurring for a good long time. There are lots of folks with this or very similar problems.

I'd like to continue using and enjoying what I have thought was a very good contribution to the globe for use on all sorts of operating systems. For decades, I've solely used Linux. I've liked Mozilla software from the get-go, and this has happened just once before several years ago. Luckily, there was a way to enable it in the "about:config" settings. Today, I couldn't even find a way to enter those settings in this newest version of Thunderbird - V115.5.0.

If the toolbar is still a feature, how do I enable it?
creator: cpkern

title: IMAP vs POP
content:
If my email provider's server was originally POP but my provider's moving to IMAP there's a good chance they'll temporarily support both versions.

And I've discovered that I can set up a 2nd email account in Thunderbird and link it to their IMAP server. Both email accounts will then download the same emails.

But of course my POP account (locally) will have a whole history of emails whereas the new IMAP account won't.

So rather can creating that 2nd email account, is it possible to set up (i.e. convert) the existing account so that it'll access the IMAP server, rather than the old POP one? I tried opening its Server Settings in Thunderbird and simply changing the Server Name and Port but that doesn't work. The Server Type remains as POP and even the Advanced settings don't offer any clue :-(

creator: fmorschel

title: Attempts to compact Thunderbird email folders have filled up my disk storage
content:
Help! I believe that repeated unsuccessful attempts to compact my overly large inbox folder have resulted in all of the available space on my hard drive being taken up by incomplete temporary MBOX files. I want to know how I can get these temporary files out of the way. Thunderbird 115.5.0, 64-bit, Windows 11.

Background: My inbox is admittedly way too large, but in the past I have compacted it regularly without problems. Recently, after deleting many messages, moving some other messages to other mail folders, and emptying the trash, I tried to compact all folders (apparently including folders for another email account), as Thunderbird suggested. That apparently failed. Then, after deleting more messages, emptying the trash, and emptying my Recycle Bin, I tried to compact just the inbox. After working for a while, Thunderbird gave me a message that compaction had failed due to lack of space on the hard drive. Indeed, the hard drive had only a couple hundred MB remaining! I cleared out a lot of files and freed up several gigabytes of storage on the hard drive, then tried again to compact the folder, only to get another failure message after Thunderbird had been working for a while. I removed still more content and gained about twice as much storage as I had had before the previous try, then tried to compact again, and got the same result after a much longer period of compacting effort by Thunderbird.
creator: smithellen

title: Thunderbird advances to next message after detaching attachment.
content:
After detaching an attachment from a message in my Inbox (viewing in Message Pane), Thunderbird automatically skips down to the next message. How do I keep it from doing that? Thunderbird 128 for Windows.

What I want is really very simple and should be logical. I read my emails in the Message Pane. After detaching a detachment, I want to then reply to the person who sent me the file. But Thunderbird automatically skips to the next message in the Inbox, so when I reflexively hit "Reply," I'm suddently replying to the wrong message. It's really annoying. :-) And makes no sense. I'm not "done" with a message just because I've detached a file...

I'm pretty sure I managed to fix this once before, but all my searches only turn up answers to turning off "auto-advance" when deleting a message, not detaching a file.
creator: svonpohl

title: Recently I have to restart Thunderbird  to receive any new emails.
content: I had been receiving new emails automatically. Now I have to restart Thunderbird to receive any new emails. My Thunderbird is set to download new emails every one minute. My email service is through Earthlink. Could this problem be related to a recent Thunderbird update? Thank you for any suggestions.

title: pasting in HTML code that has attachments
content:
Greetings.

For lack of anything better I'm using TBird as an HTML editor.

I'm writing a rather long paper that includes many images. Backing up as I go, I use the 'Export Message As > HTML Format > Messages And Attachments' ... and it works fine and processes the images this way:

Anyway -- this is kinda hard to explain -- as long as I was 'working within TBird' everything was fine, but I ended up modifying my HTML via text editor to do a few things that were impossible to do in the graphical TBird screen (tweaking some math equations). So now my draft message needed to be updated with the new HTML. I use 'Insert > HTML' and paste in the entire contents of my paper and then Send it to myself. I get it back, open it and there's no images, just blank boxes.

But ... and this is interesting ... if I then take that message and save it again as HTML (as above) then if I view that HTML in FireFox, voila! It shows the images. So how can I take my HTML, import it to an email and then 'Edit As New Message' or whatever trick is needed to have the paper back with it's images intact? I hope that's not too confusing.

Could someone kindly tell me how to reset my Thunderbird password and advise me how to clear my archive....or explain why I still cannot SEND new messages?
creator: ashmmackinnon

title: Search Bar Restricted Due To Fault Or Update?
content: Hi, I've enjoyed using Thunderbird calander for years; now using 128.1.0esr (64-bit), the GB / UK version; but something's wrong now. In calander I've been able to use the search bar at the top of the page for searching through the whole of the calander. It's been really useful, checking when I last had appointments at the dentist, opticians etc. so I can plan when I need to book my next visit. I've been able to search through the time lines of various events, very useful for seeing the history of something I want to check. Now I can't do that. I miss it very much. It was quite possibly the main feature of the calanders usefulness for me. The search bar is still there, but now I see a box with lot's of functions to restrict the calanders searching. I don't know if it was there before; I certainly never used it. The best option I can see to search only covers the calanders month or current view. All the other options want you to look forward. I don't want to look forwards. I want to look back. All the way back to when I first started putting enteries into the calander. Those historical entries are really important to me. How can I research things like when I moved house, and I moved years ago, but can't recall when, which is why I had a searchable calander. Have I done something wrong to prevent the historical searching? I've tried looking at all the options settings that I could turn on or off, but can't see anything that will restore the search bar to it's former self. Have I missed something? Can you tell me how to get the full search functionality back please? I'm really hoping that it's not the result of an upgrade to 'improve' calander. If it is, please restore the search function asap. As it stands calander is no longer fit for my purpose. Please help. Many thanks, Jerry.
creator: jerry.healy0804

title: thunderbird
content: Dzień dobry, dot. 128.1.0esr (64 bity) Windows 11 pro, w folderze odebrane, wysłane widać listę wiadomości ale po wybraniu wiadomości jest czysta biała karta bez treści i załączników, po wykonaniu opcji naprawy folderu znikają wiadomość np z 2024 roku a pozostają np z 2019 roku. Już zdarzyło się to nam na 4 instalacjach thunderbird na rożnych komputerach i skrzynkach emial/domenach serwerach. Prośba o pomoc dziękuję Artur
creator: info7203

title: Thunderbird
content:
I experience this after upgrading to Nebula:

I get a message to login from time to time. You can see what happens in the attached file.

Please help me! Thank you in advance. /Peter Gyarmati
creator: peter.gyarmati

title: Is this a security problem - marking "junk"??
content:
Using 115.10.1 (32-bit), Windows 11.

I get a lot of SPAM. Much is filtered out upstream (via a Barracuda system supplied by my ISP) More (but less effectively) by Thunderbird. But some (too much) still gets through.

My question - most of the time I can recognize it's SPAM by only looking at headers - subject, and correspondent (sender). I have no need to check the email content.

But to junk the email I need to select it, which causes the email content to appear by the built in browser in TB.

Not an expert, but this seems like an unnecessary security risk, that gives the email content (and any included code) time to do something. Am I overthinking this? Is there a way to mark an email junk without selecting it?

thx,
creator: markeh

title: Find error in msgFilterrules.dat file
content: Have several email accounts working in TB. Consolidated multiple Msg. Filter files into just ONE to be placed in all accounts, used Notepad / Word naming it .dat without .txt This has worked fine before. Somewhere within the new .dat file I believe there is some sort of ERROR, and it can't be read by TB at program start. Wondering if there are any tools for checking the integrity of the filter file. TB Trouble Shooter was no help. SEE THE IMAGE HERE.
creator: mminieri

title: Html and other code showing in emails
content:
I'm seeing strange coding or gibberish in emails. Here is an example. I have at least a dozen more:

"Access the Rate Sheet3/06223f89-f6eb-4b46-a5d0-1806e3b1ffe7.png" style="display: block; padding: 0px; text-align: left; height: 26; width: 250; border: 0px; background-color:#ffffff;" title="Pennymac" width="250" xt="SPIMAGE" shrinktofit="true"> Log on to Power+3/3225b119-629a-475b-9ea6-ee760f966f82.png" style="display: block; padding: 0px; text-align: center; height: 50px; width: 500px; border: 0px; background-color:#ffffff;" title="Pennymac" width="500" xt="SPIMAGE" shrinktofit="true">"

This strange behavior does not occur in the same email on Mac Mail, where it looks completely normal.

title: Importing old profile to new iMac
content:
Does an imported TB profile overwrite the existing files in a new TB install?

I set up one existing account and have imported the profile for all my TB accounts. I am hesitant to import all of the profiles because of the one (oldest account) could be overwritten and TB did not leave any messages on the gmail IMAP server.

The other accounts do not exist on the new install (new machine)

I'm using MAC OS 14.6.1 on an M3 iMac
creator: 2much

title: One Email Account has Password Issue
content:
I have used Thunderbird for several years with two emails from brighthouse.com (now spectrum). One of the accounts recently (2 week) started prompting for password and never accepts my password as valid. I still can get emails on it but can't send.

I am using the same password I use to get access to account on my second email account on Thunderbird, as well as the spectrum webmail app, and my cell phone without issue.

Attached are screenshots of the server settings for IMAP and SMTP. Your help would be appreciated.
creator: jlcinfo

content:

title: Sent items missing, Sent items blank
content:
Hello, I have three issues with my Sent items / Sent folder. Issue 1: Sent emails from 7/30/21 to 1/15/24 are missing. Issue 2: Sent emails from 1/15/24 to 8/7/24 are missing. Issue 3: When clicking to open a sent email from yesterday or older, the From and Subject will be blank and the Content will be displayed as: --------------090809000502050303050709—

After googling for help, I went to Edit / Folder Properties / Repair Folder. That did not help. If I “search” for a missing email, it will be listed in the results, but when I click to open, “No message found”. Thank you.
creator: marci6

title: lost several years of email after "repair folder"
content:
• for Inbox:
  • TB performed a "compact"
  • emails did not show up in the view panel
  • I performed a "repair folder"
  • emails after 9/2021-today have disappeared

It appears that other folders are intact.

How can I get back emails from the missing years, especially this past year?

Thanks Peter
creator: peter.davidoff

title: Mini Calendar events
content: Hi, new here! Using TB 128 on win 11. Below the mini calendar in the today pane I have a list of events showing. I also have events entered for future and previous months. When I click on one of the arrows next the month, the month switches over but the events list does not. E.g., the month shows October and the events list still shows August. Is that how the calendar is supposed to work?
creator: em6

title: Menubalk bij berichten
content: Sinds kort heb ik Mint 22 geïnstalleerd en daarbij kwam Thunderbird 128 mee. Nu zijn in het berichtenvenster geen kolommen als: bericht, afzender, datum etc. meer zichtbaar maar een "vakje" per bericht met daaronder een voor mij heleboel "abacadabra". Is het mogelijk die indeling in kolommen weer zichtbaar te maken en de nu gegeven extra info te verbergen?

title: Thunderbird email problems
content: 'With new update my thunderbird emails are not showing up when I click on them, even though i see them in my inbox. This has happened after the new update'

title: Thunderbird unable to receive emails from outlook
content:
Have Thunderbird linked with outlook. Opening Thunderbird a request for password box appears. Have read Thunderbird description of what to do and why it has started beginning of year. Changed normal password to Oauth2 both in Thunderbird and Outlook as directed, plus verified all other necessary server inputs. A dialogue box appears stating outlook does not support 0auth2 authentication method, so have to revert Thunderbird to normal password and then back to having to enter password to open TB which most often will not open. Frustrating.

Please advise a solution.

Thank you
creator: jbuskuhl

title: Thunderbird won't mark emails as read
content: Recently, Thunderbird has stopped marking messages as read once I open a new message & read it. It stays highlighted as if the message still hasn't been read. I have to manually mark it read by using the M key. It does this in Troubleshooting mode or regular mode. HOw can I fix this?
creator: dreamspinner3

title: I can not access my magma account
content: I can not access my magma account. My password is not being accepted??

title: Nord VPN
content: Nord keeps telling me that Mozilla Thunderbird Version 128.0.1 Severity level : High. Exploiting this vulnerability is relatively straight forward for attackers. They may gain unauthorized access to your data or cause system disruptions. Risk mitigation is needed. This message was also for the latest 115 version. Then I updated to 128 and it has the same problem
creator: bfclarke

title: Thunderbird stuck in an update loop on Azure
content:
Hi folks,

We have all of our users running Thunderbird on Azure Remote Desktop (Windows 11). With the release of 128.1.0 we're seeing all of users stuck in an update loop where Thunderbird will update to 128.1.0 esr but as soon as the user signs off, it reverts to 128.0.1 esr. When they sign back in, users get a message that their profile is outdated and must be recreated.

What's going on?
creator: jason152

title: filters on Thunderbird
content: Is it possible to import filters from another installation of Thunderbird (actually Postbox)?
creator: gerald.ten

title: Thunderbird is impossibly slow to load
content:
I've had Thunderbird on my Windows 8 computer which has been running just fine until a recent update. It's now so slow to load I'm going to have to either go back to an earlier rev, or load another email client. I've got 128.1.0esr installed. I've got a 2.6 G processer w/ 8 GB of Ram. Ideas to resolve this problem would be appreciated.

Thanks, Jack
creator: captjack1

title: How can I revert the update to Thunderbird 128 Nebula?
content: I am using Thunderbird on Windows 11 and I have foolishly allowed it to update itself to release 128.1.0.esr without checking the bug reports first. Now it turns out that this release removed the possibility to search the calendar for past events, which is absolutely essential for me. There is a Bugzilla entry for this but it is bogged down in discussions about who needs which date ranges to search in and how many instances to show for recurring events, so I don't expect a solution any time soon. How can I revert Thunderbird to the last release which still has that functionality? I have regular backups of my userprofile folder in case it helps.
creator: tilmanschmidt
